adjective.description: Of, relating to, or characteristic of pagans.

origin: Late 17th century; earliest use found in Andrew Marvell (1621–1678), poet and politician. Either from post-classical Latin paganicus of or relating to pagans, specifically use of classical Latin pāgānicus of or belonging to the village people from pāgānus inhabitant of a rural community + -icus, or independently from pagan + -ic.
